channel.title: Just got robbed
channel.description:
At a bus station for 3 zips (84 grams) of Purple Kush, $500 cash, my ipod and phone. Jumped by two black guys who then just ran off, ditched my bag, and by the time I discovered all they took were long gone.
Buut, the good news is, all that $ was my dealer's for fronted haze, so with his help we found out who the guys were. We can roll up today and break their legs with bats and that seemssss to be the best choice but I was wondering if anyone else had any idea how to do with these people (obviously police can not be involved since the stolen property included illegal drugs lol). I'm not a violent person but when it comes to something like this its a survival thing, I NEED to get that stuff back to pay rent and avoid myself getting jumped again.
Thoughts? Thanks lol.

The study found that people are 21 times more likely to be killed by someone they know than a stranger breaking into the house. Half of the murders were over arguments or romantic triangles. The study also found that the increased murder rate in gun-owning households was entirely due to an increase in gun homicides only, not any other murder method. It further found that gun-owning households saw an increased murder risk by family or intimate acquaintances, not by strangers or non-intimate acquaintances. That is how it was here too, but, thankfully, the law was changed a few years ago regarding self-defense. It used to be if you killed someone in self-defense, the burden was on you to prove it actually was a legal self-defense case. If you couldn’t meet your burden of proof, you were found guilty and went to jail. (which made it basically guilty until proven innocent) Now the law is that the burden of proof is on the prosecutor to prove that it WASN’T self-defense, so it’s much better now.
